column5: Well yesterday we decided we would head up to keswick for a little bit of perch action if we were lucky... the morning started at 6 am when we woke up and after leaving the house at 7 we were only about an hour and a half from keswick. We arrived at about 8:30 and met with hopped on board the nada argo to be brought onto the Ice. unfortunately the bite was slow but we did manage to catch 8 of em, all approx 7 inches... Heres a couple of pictures on the Ice.  Simcoes landscape...    The minnows... not much smaller than the perch we caught and they were much more abundant    A picture down the hole... kinda cool how much light there is almost like the ice is a spotlight...   And the star of the day, a 7 3/4 " perch!    althought the bite wasn't all that great for us we did enjoy ourselves and it was much warmer in the hut than it would have been out in the wind... Thanks for reading...
are you entering the 7 inch perch? loll Nice to see you got into some fish, too bad no luck with bigger ones.
well done bill...thanks for the report,and hey at least you had a nice day on the ice and the weather was good,oh well better luck next time....cheers
Yup... I am glad I got to go on the Ice anyway... Very enjoyable and comfortable day out there...
Well, at least ya got out.  And you got fish.  Great report.  Nice tail pinch btw  Joey
Thanks for the report - nice pics. 007
Thanks for sharing Bill.I feel better now knowing that the Perch I registered today was 10 inches for team 4.

Bill...great report!  I still have never caught anything thru the ice...oh well, there's always next year...looks like i wont get out on the ice again any time soon.  That was a cool shot down the hole too!  Thanks for takin the time to report!
